0.title: Rename UP's Sultanpur to Kushbhawanpur: BJP MLA to CM Yogi
0.article_body: BJP MLA from Sultanpur Vinod Singh, in a letter to UP CM Yogi Adityanath, said his constituency must be renamed as Kushbhawanpur. Sultanpur has many religious places which stress the belief that Kush, Lord Ram's son, developed it as his capital and called it Kushbhawanpur, Singh said. "Later, Khilji Badshah named it as Sultanpur for promoting his culture," he added.

1.title: Hyderabad-based startup launches foldable electric bicycle
1.article_body: Hyderabad-based startup company 'Kachbo Design' launched a first-of-its-kind electric bicycle on Sunday. The 'Hornback' bicycle can be folded and carried inside a car or even be pushed around like a trolley. Jayesh Ranjan, the principal secretary for Telangana's IT, Industries and Commerce department, said that e-bicycles will be added to the state's e-vehicle policy.

2.title: SRH to bowl first against unbeaten GT, both teams unchanged
2.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) captain Kane Williamson won the toss and elected to bowl first against Gujarat Titans (GT) in their IPL 2022 clash on Monday. Both the teams are playing with an unchanged playing XI. GT are currently third on the points table and are the only unbeaten side in the tournament so far. SRH are eighth on the table.

3.title: It'll be different feeling: Rashid ahead of GT's game vs his ex-team SRH
3.article_body: Ahead of GT-SRH in IPL 2022, GT spinner Rashid Khan said it'll be a different kind of feeling to play against his ex-team, which he represented for five years. "Bowling to someone like Kane Williamson is always a huge pleasure as a bowler. We had a good five years together...now against each other...it's a lovely contest," he added.

4.title: Congress expels ex-MLA Surjit Dhiman for 'anti-party' activities
4.article_body: Ex-Congress MLA Surjit Singh Dhiman was expelled from the party’s primary membership for alleged "anti-party" activities on Sunday. The move came after Dhiman reportedly questioned the appointment of Gidderbaha MLA Amarinder Singh Raja Warring as Punjab Pradesh Congress Committee's (PPCC) new chief. Meanwhile, Congress stated that expulsion orders were issued against Dhiman for his "indiscipline".

5.title: Happy that Ranbir, Alia are fulfilling Rishi's dream: Subhash Ghai
5.article_body: Reacting to Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding, filmmaker Subhash Ghai has said he is happy that Ranbir and Alia are fulfilling Rishi Kapoor's dream. "In January 2020...I had gone to meet Rishi at his home...He was so happy to share...that they were planning his son Ranbir's marriage with Alia in December 2020 in a big way," Subhash stated.

6.title: We are backing him here fully: Pant on DC teammate Kuldeep
6.article_body: Talking about Kuldeep Yadav, who has been part of all four matches that DC have played so far, captain Rishabh Pant said they're fully backing the pacer. "Kuldeep has been working for one year but hasn't been getting chances," he added. Kuldeep didn't play a single game for KKR in IPL 2021. He took four wickets against KKR on Sunday.

7.title: No one will be allowed to take law into their own hands: K'taka CM
7.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Monday said the government will not tolerate violence and no one will be allowed to take law into their own hands in the name of religion. The government is not against anyone propagating his or her ideology, Bommai said. He added that his government wants to speak through actions and not through words.

8.title: Shiv Kumar Subramaniam got me my 1st writing credit: Anurag Kashyap
8.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap on Monday took to Instagram to mourn the demise of actor Shiv Kumar Subramaniam. He wrote, "Shiv...asked...to also put my name as the writer's credit [in 'Auto Narayan']. That's how I got my first screenwriting credit." Anurag further wrote, "I owe so much of what I am to Shiva Dada...The most generous, beautiful man I've known."

9.title: Ukraine's economy to shrink by 45.1% due to war in 2022: World Bank
9.article_body: Ukraine's economy will contract by 45.1% this year due to conflict with Russia, the World Bank said on Sunday. It also said that the Russian economy will shrink by 11.2% due to financial sanctions imposed in response to the invasion. "Our forecasts show that the Russian invasion...has reversed the region's recovery from the pandemic," a senior World Bank official said.

10.title: Grateful, humbled that 2 of my films are in ₹1,000cr club: Rajamouli
10.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli has stated that he is grateful, humbled and overwhelmed that he has two films, 'Baahubali 2' and 'RRR', that have entered the ₹1,000 crore club. "The success of both 'Baahubali 2' and 'RRR' has reiterated that a film based on human emotions can cut geographical boundaries and translate beyond the language," the filmmaker added.

11.title: Members of AISA detained for protesting against JNU violence in Delhi
11.article_body: Police detained members of the All India Students Association (AISA) for protesting outside Sardar Patel Bhawan, against the violence that broke out between two groups in JNU. "Women protesters were manhandled and their clothes were pulled by male security personnel. Several protesters also got injured. We have been detained inside the Tughlak Road Police Station," AISA activist Neha said.

12.title: Man told by boss to 'send wife for a night' if he wanted transfer in UP, kills self
12.article_body: A UP Power Department employee died by suicide after he was allegedly told by a Junior Engineer to 'send his wife for a night' if he wanted a transfer. The 45-year-old set himself on fire outside the engineer's office in Lakhimpur Kheri and died during treatment. The man had recorded a video saying he'd complained but no action was taken.

13.title: Young filmmakers have faith in their actors: Satish Kaushik
13.article_body: Actor Satish Kaushik has said that young filmmakers know the importance of time and have faith in their actors. "They offer you a complete script before the shoot begins and conduct workshops and readings with actors before the film goes on floors," he stated. "All this ensures...they don't waste time during the shoot...explaining what they want," Satish further said.

14.title: Hardik seems to be relishing his role as captain for GT: Harbhajan
14.article_body: Ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said that Hardik Pandya seems to be "relishing" his role as Gujarat Titans' captain in IPL 2022. "He's performing with the bat for GT and has also started bowling well which are good signs for Team India as well," he added. GT have won all three matches they have played so far.

15.title: TCS hires record 1,03,546 employees in 2021-22
15.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) on Monday said that it made a record hiring by adding 1,03,546 employees in the financial year ending March 2022. "In Q4, TCS added 35,209 employees on a net basis, the highest ever net addition in a quarter," TCS further noted. It added that IT services attrition continued to climb and reached 17.4% during the quarter.

16.title: Meet the 'miniature kangaroo': UK zoo on pics of rare newborn dusky pademelon
16.article_body: A baby dusky pademelon was finally spotted peeking out from his mother's pouch at the Chester Zoo in the UK a few months after birth. Sharing a glimpse of the baby pademelon on social media, the zoo wrote, "Meet the new 'miniature kangaroo' here at the zoo!" Pademelons are born just the size of a jelly bean, the zoo said.

17.title: Indian husband-wife, who each have unicorn startups, plan first startup IPO
17.article_body: Indian husband-wife Ruchi Kalra and Asish Mohapatra, who each built their own billion-dollar startups OfBusiness and Oxyzo Financial Services, are planning their first IPO. OfBusiness, a supplier of raw materials to small businesses, could go for an IPO in six months to a year, Co-founder Kalra said. The couple's other unicorn Oxyzo could float shares in two years, she added.

18.title: Pune's SPPU demands equal rights for disabled students, set up centre
18.article_body: Pune's Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) has become the first state university to approve the establishment of a centre for mental health and disabilities, to ensure inclusive education for all. It has been established to respond to the needs of a community that people turned a blind eye to, said Chetan Diwan, Chairman, Board of Studies, Disability Studies at SPPU.

19.title: Delivery boy murdered over old enmity in Mira Bhayandar, 2 arrested
19.article_body: Two men, who were out on bail, allegedly murdered a 26-year-old food delivery man in Maharashtra's Mira Bhayandar in an act of revenge. The victim was apparently taken to an abandoned area before being bludgeoned to death with stones. "Both the accused who have a history of committing serious offences, executed this murder to settle scores of...previous enmity," police said.

20.title: Devotee dies due to electrocution at ISKCON temple in Mumbai
20.article_body: A devotee died due to electrocution at the ISKCON temple in the Juhu area of Mumbai, police said on Monday. Police have arrested the contractor and registered a case of negligence against him after the incident. However, it is yet not clear how the devotee got electrocuted, the Juhu Police added.

21.title: It's okay to be a plus-size person, I block the trolls: Priyamani
21.article_body: Actress Priyamani in an interview has stated that it's okay to be a plus-size person, adding that being happy is of the utmost importance. She further said that trolls feel that they have the authority to say whatever they want to say. "Certain times a few comments are too harsh to digest. I straight away block such trolls," Priyamani added.

22.title: Lukaku, Barkley, Callum, Chilwell won't play vs Real Madrid: Tuchel
22.article_body: Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel said Romelu Lukaku, Ross Barkley, Callum Hudson-Odoi and Ben Chilwell will not be available for the Champions League Round of 16 fixture against Real Madrid at the Santiago Bernabéu. "Callum...Chilwell [are] out. Romelu will not travel...due to the pain in his Achilles...Barkley is sick...will not travel," Tuchel said. The second-leg match will be played on Tuesday.

23.title: Microplastics in Cauvery may be harming fish: IISc Bengaluru study
23.article_body: Microplastics and other pollutants may be causing growth defects in fish in the Cauvery river, as per a study by the Indian Institute of Science (IISc) in Bengaluru. The defects include skeletal deformities. For the study, water samples were collected from three different locations with varying speeds of water flow.

24.title: Auto, cab drivers in Delhi demand subsidy on CNG prices
24.article_body: Auto and taxi drivers in Delhi staged a protest outside the Delhi Secretariat on Monday demanding subsidy on CNG prices. General Secretary of Delhi Auto Rickshaw Sangh, Rajendra Soni, said the "unprecedented" price hike has broken the backbone of auto and cab drivers, adding that they would go on an indefinite strike from April 18 if their demands aren't met.

25.title: TCS records ₹50,591 crore revenue in Q4, net profit at ₹9,926 crore
25.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) revenue in Q4 FY22 grew 15.8% YoY to ₹50,591 crore, crossing the ₹50,000 crore mark for the first time. Its total revenue in FY22 stood at ₹1,91,754 crore, up 16.8% YoY. The company recorded net profit of ₹9,926 crore in Q4, a rise of 7.4% YoY from ₹9,246 crore in Q4 FY21.

26.title: Fighting Hindutva is major challenge for CPI(M): Sitaram Yechury
26.article_body: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury said on Monday that combatting the "Hindutva communal agenda" is a major challenge for the party. He further alleged that besides northern states, the northeast region of India is also becoming "rapidly and most dangerously communalised". Yechury's remarks come a day after he was re-elected as the party's General Secretary for a third consecutive term.

27.title: Mumbai Police band plays Egyptian song 'Ya Mustafa', video released
27.article_body: The Mumbai Police's band Khaki Studio on Monday released an instrumental cover of 'Ya Mustafa', a song composed by Egyptian musician Mohamed Fawzi. In the video, the band members can be seen playing the song using instruments like tenor saxophone, euphonium, flat clarinet, tuba and flute. Previously, the band released their version of the song 'Srivalli' from 'Pushpa: The Rise'.

28.title: Movie-going experience in India is exhilarating: Yahya Abdul-Mateen II
28.article_body: American actor Yahya Abdul-Mateen II in an interview has stated that the movies and movie-going experience in India are exhilarating for him. "The (aspect of the culture) is infused into one...spectacle [here]," the actor added. He further said that he is influenced a lot by that aspect. "I am indeed inspired by a lot of things from India," Yahya added.

29.title: MP govt bulldozes houses of those who pelted stones at Ram Navami procession
29.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government on Monday started demolishing houses of those who pelted stones at a Ram Navami procession in Khargone on Sunday. A video shows bulldozers razing the houses of the accused. Earlier in the day, state Home Minister Narottam Mishra said that houses of those who pelted stones will be 'reduced to a pile of stones'.

30.title: Clash of students at JNU hostel is 'unfortunate': Delhi Home Minister
30.article_body: The clash of students at the Jawaharlal Nehru University's Kaveri Hostel was an "unfortunate" incident, Delhi Home Minister Satyendar Jain said on Monday. Asked about the incident by reporters, Jain said, "I am the Home Minister of Delhi. You should ask this question to the Home Minister under whom the Delhi Police is."

31.title: PTI lawmakers to resign from Pak's National Assembly: Imran Khan
31.article_body: Pakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan on Monday said that lawmakers from his party, Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI), will resign from the National Assembly amid a political crisis in the country. Shehbaz Sharif was elected as the country's new PM today. Imran Khan was removed as PM after he lost a no-trust vote against him after midnight on Sunday.

32.title: Hopefully, he gets in CSK halfway through IPL 2022: Hogg on Chahar
32.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said CSK need their pacer Deepak Chahar, who is currently recovering from a quadriceps injury, back in the team for the ongoing IPL. "Hopefully, he gets there halfway through the season," he added. He further said that Chahar's swing bowling in powerplay overs takes pressure off the other bowlers, especially the spinners in those middle overs.

33.title: Oil prices drop below $100 mark on China lockdown, release of reserves
33.article_body: Oil prices dropped below the $100 mark on Monday on plans to release record volumes of crude and oil products and on continuing lockdowns in China. Brent crude slipped $3.93 to $98.85/barrel while US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) fell $4.19 to $94.07/barrel. The International Energy Agency member nations, along with the US, will release 240 million barrels within six months.

34.title: Chennai software firm gifts cars to 100 employees for 5 years of service
34.article_body: Chennai-based software firm Ideas2IT on Monday gifted Maruti Suzuki cars to 100 employees who have worked for five years at the company. The decision of gifting cars was collectively decided by the employees, Murali Vivekanandan, who founded Ideas2IT in 2009, told Moneycontrol. "This (car) is what they have done. And, not for what they are going to do," Vivekanandan added.

35.title: Ready to enter politics if people want, says Robert Vadra
35.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's husband Robert Vadra said he is ready to enter politics if people want. "If people wish I should represent them and if I can bring some change for them, then I will definitely take this step," he added. When asked about the present political scenario in the country, he said he feels "uneasy".

36.title: Policeman dies by suicide after consuming poison in Gurugram
36.article_body: An Assistant Sub-Inspector posted at Pataudi police station in Gurugram district died by suicide after consuming some poisonous substance on Sunday, according to a PTI report. The policeman took the extreme step at home and died in a hospital. The policeman has accused senior officers of harassment in a suicide note, the report said.

37.title: India's consumption of petroleum products hits 3-year high in March
37.article_body: The total petroleum product consumption in March stood at 19.41 million tonnes, the highest since March 2019, according to the latest data from the Petroleum Planning and Analysis Cell of the Oil Ministry. Diesel, the most used fuel in the country, saw the demand rising by 6.7% to 7.7 million tonnes. Petrol sales were up 6.1% at 2.91 million tonnes.

38.title: 'Jersey' accused of plagiarism, case to be heard in Bombay High Court: Reports
38.article_body: Shahid Kapoor and Mrunal Thakur-starrer 'Jersey' has been accused of plagiarism by a writer named Rajneesh Jaiswal, reports said on Monday. Jaiswal has reportedly claimed that the movie's script/story belongs to him. The matter will be heard in Bombay High Court today, reports further said. The film's release has been postponed to April 22.

39.title: Jadeja, MSD are talking almost every day about CSK captaincy: Hussey
39.article_body: CSK batting coach Michael Hussey said Ravindra Jadeja and MS Dhoni talk about captaincy "almost every day". "Dhoni was the captain for such a long period...he has done an amazing job...great thing is that he's still here to help Jadeja...in his first year as captain," he added. Hussey further said that everyone in the team "highly" respects Jadeja.

40.title: Not much pressure if our score is over 200: Rishabh Pant
40.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) captain Rishabh Pant has said that the "pressure is not as much" if they post over 200 runs on the scoreboard. "In these conditions, when the dew is not there if teams score 170-180 it is decent and the pressure is not as much as it is when the score is 200 or more," Pant said.

41.title: Lee Jung Jae & Lee Byung Hun's characters to return in Squid Game 2
41.article_body: Hwang Dong-hyuk, director of South Korean survival drama series 'Squid Game', recently confirmed that Lee Jung Jae's character Seong Gi-hun and Lee Byung Hun's character Front Man will return in the next season of the show. "Gi-hun for sure. He'll be back and I believe the Front Man will be back too," Hwang said at an event.

42.title: Hate, violence weakening country: Rahul post Ram Navami violence
42.article_body: Responding to communal clashes that broke out in Gujarat during Ram Navami processions, which left one dead, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said that hate, violence and exclusion are weakening India. "The path to progress is paved with the bricks of brotherhood, peace and harmony. Let's stand together to secure a just, inclusive India," Rahul further said.

43.title: Karan Mahara becomes the new President of Uttarakhand Congress
43.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi appointed former Ranikhet MLA Karan Mahara as the new President of the Uttarakhand Congress unit. Mahara will take over the reins from former Srinagar MLA Ganesh Godiyal. Bajpur MLA Yashpal Arya has been appointed as the CLP leader while Khatima MLA Bhuwan Kapri, who defeated CM Pushkar Singh Dhami, is appointed as the deputy CLP leader.

44.title: This guy can lead: Shastri on Hardik Pandya's Gujarat Titans captaincy
44.article_body: Ravi Shastri, speaking about Hardik Pandya's captaincy, has said, "Don't take your eye off...ball there guys. This guy can lead a side." "Right before this IPL...question that was asked about a lot of young captains, the word was KL Rahul, Shreyas Iyer, Rishabh Pant. Add Hardik," Shastri stated. Gujarat Titans have won all three matches in IPL 2022 so far.

45.title: Faf du Plessis should have been CSK skipper after MS Dhoni: Shastri
45.article_body: Ravi Shastri said Ravindra Jadeja should have played as a player in IPL 2022, whereas, Faf du Plessis should've been CSK skipper after MS Dhoni. "CSK should've not let Faf go because he's...match-winner and played a lot," Shastri stated. Faf was bought by RCB for ₹7 crore in the mega auction and is leading the franchise in IPL 2022.

46.title: Delhi govt to launch anti-open burning campaign from Tuesday
46.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Monday said the Delhi government will launch a month-long anti-open burning campaign from Tuesday to curb road dust pollution. Of Delhi's 17 city forests, four will be developed at "world-class level", Rai added. Delhi's PWD will set up a taskforce to map areas where green belt is required to be developed on roadsides.

47.title: Sri Lanka will opt for Constitutional means to oust govt: Oppn leader
47.article_body: Sri Lankan Opposition leader Sajith Premadasa has said that country will opt for Constitutional provisions to oust incumbent government amid economic crisis. "We will represent...citizens and...have an organic uprising but will ensure that [it is]...peaceful," he added. Thousands of Sri Lankans have been protesting against the government as the country grapples with food shortages and power cuts.

48.title: Shehbaz Sharif elected as Pakistan's new Prime Minister
48.article_body: Pakistan's Opposition leader Shehbaz Sharif has been elected as the country's new Prime Minister. The 70-year-old Pakistan Muslim League (N) chief is the former Pakistan Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif's younger brother. This comes after Imran Khan was removed as Pakistan's Prime Minister after he lost the no-trust vote against him in the National Assembly after midnight on Sunday.

49.title: Had affair with a well-known director, got pregnant but aborted it: Mandana
49.article_body: Mandana Karimi revealed on Sunday's episode of 'Lock Upp' that she was in a secret relationship with a "very well-known" director after her separation from her husband. She said the director is someone who "talks about women's rights and independence of women in the outside world", adding, "We planned pregnancy but when it happened, he completely backed off."

50.title: I'm enjoying GT captaincy, have become a better cricketer: Hardik
50.article_body: Gujarat Titans skipper Hardik Pandya has said that he's enjoying his captaincy and added he always wanted to have a responsibility as a cricketer. "That's the reason I have become a better cricketer because facing challenges makes you better," Hardik stated. With three matches played so far, Hardik's Gujarat Titans are the only unbeaten side in the ongoing IPL 2022.

51.title: Mumbai-Gandhinagar Shatabdi gets vistadome coach, Railways shares video
51.article_body: The Indian Railways has added a vistadome coach to the Mumbai- Gandhinagar Capital Shatabdi Express for a panoramic view. A video of the coach shared by the Railways shows passengers during the journey. "The large glass windows and glass roofs provide a panoramic view of the picturesque route," the Indian Railways wrote on Twitter.

52.title: Chahal argues with umpire after wide call, video goes viral
52.article_body: RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal was seen arguing with the on-field umpire after he signalled a delivery as wide during the 18th over of LSG's innings. The ball appeared to be inside the marker when it passed the stumps, with the commentators also terming the call as wrong. Chahal went on to dismiss Dushmantha Chameera off the next delivery.

53.title: Around 200 bouncers hired for Alia, Ranbir's wedding: Alia's half-brother
53.article_body: Speaking about  Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's wedding, the former's half-brother Rahul Bhatt said that around 200 bouncers are hired for the wedding. "Yusuf Bhai has taken over the security of Alia...and Ranbir Kapoor's wedding. He has Mumbai's best security force- 9/11 agency," Rahul said. He added guards will be deployed at both RK Studio and Vastu in Chembur.

54.title: Laws should be enacted after thorough debate & discussion: Om Birla
54.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Monday said the primary responsibility of the legislature is to fulfil the aspirations of the people while laws should be enacted after thorough debate and discussion. "Democratic institutions from Panchayat to Parliament should follow this," Birla said. He was speaking at the inaugural session of the 8th CPA India Regional Conference organised in Guwahati.

55.title: Ban the person for life if such things happen today: Shastri on Chahal's balcony incident
55.article_body: After Yuzvendra Chahal revealed a cricketer hung him from a 15th-floor balcony after getting drunk during IPL 2013, Ravi Shastri said, "It's the first time I am hearing such a drastic thing like this." He added, "If such things happen today, a life ban for that person involved and send that person to a rehab centre as quickly as possible."

56.title: Arjun Kapoor, Abhimanyu Dassani mourn demise of Shiv Kumar Subramaniam
56.article_body: Arjun Kapoor took to Instagram Stories to mourn the demise of actor Shiv Kumar Subramaniam, with whom he worked in '2 States'. "Rest in peace, Shiv sir. You'll be missed," he wrote with a broken heart emoji. Abhimanyu Dassani, who shared screen space with Shiv in 'Meenakshi Sundareshwar', wrote, "Will always cherish the evening walks with you...Rest in peace sir."

57.title: Crane that caused traffic jam in Delhi, Gurugram removed after 26 hrs
57.article_body: A crane that caused a traffic jam on the Delhi-Gurugram Expressway (NH-48) on Saturday has been removed after 26 hours. The police said that engineers from Mumbai had been called to repair and change the tyres of the crane to help it move. The crane had caused a traffic jam on the road for many hours after catching fire.

58.title: It's about being Rajasthan Royals: Sanju Samson on Ashwin getting retired out
58.article_body: Talking about Ravichandran Ashwin getting retired out against LSG in their IPL 2022 match on Sunday, RR captain Sanju Samson said, "It's about being Rajasthan Royals." He added, "We keep trying different things. We had been talking about it before the season. We thought...if some situation occurs, we can use it." He stated that it was a team decision.

59.title: Kuldeep's chances of Team India comeback have increased: Gavaskar
59.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav bowled exceptionally well against KKR, picking wickets at "crucial times" in the game. "The fact that he has now begun to pick wickets means that chances of him making a comeback to the Indian team also increases," added Gavaskar. Kuldeep picked four wickets, conceding 35 runs against KKR.

60.title: Jailed Hong Kong media mogul Jimmy Lai appeals to UN over cases
60.article_body: Imprisoned media mogul Jimmy Lai's lawyers are asking UN to investigate multiple criminal charges levied against him in Hong Kong, citing them as “legal harassment” against him. Lai, who's also a pro-democracy activist and publisher of defunct Apple Daily newspaper, was charged under Hong Kong's national security law. He was initially arrested for participating in pro-democracy protests in 2019.

61.title: Who are the highest wicket-takers in IPL 2022 after 20 matches?
61.article_body: Following the conclusion of first 20 matches of IPL 2022, RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal leads the list of highest wicket-takers in the tournament with 11 scalps. He is followed by KKR's Umesh Yadav and DC's Kuldeep Yadav, who have taken 10 wickets each. RCB's Wanindu Hasaranga and LSG's Avesh Khan have taken eight wickets each in the tournament so far.

62.title: Man succumbs to injuries after stone-pelting incident in Jharkhand village
62.article_body: A man succumbed to his injuries following an incident of stone-pelting during a Ram Navami procession on Sunday evening in Hirhi village of Jharkhand's Lohardaga district, officials said, adding that 12 others have sustained injuries. Ten bikes and a pick-up van were set on fire during the violence, officials further said. Internet services have been suspended in Lohardaga town.

63.title: Pakistan stocks jump the most since 2020 after Imran Khan removed as PM
63.article_body: Pakistan stocks have rallied after former cricketer Imran Khan was removed as Prime Minister, raising hopes that the election of Shehbaz Sharif as the next Prime Minister would bring political stability to the country. The KSE-100 (Karachi Stock Exchange) jumped 3.4%, the most since November 2020. Furthermore, Pakistan's currency climbed to the highest level since March 30.

64.title: Hope we continue to make hits: B Praak on working with Harrdy in 'Kudiyan...'
64.article_body: Speaking about his experience of composing song 'Kudiyan Lahore Diyan' for singer Harrdy Sandhu and for his channel, singer B Praak said, "From 'Bijlee Bijlee' to 'Kudiyan Lahore Diyan', I think, fans are seeing Harrdy in an altogether different light. It was...fun composing and producing this one with him." "I...hope we continue to make hits like this," he added.

65.title: After break up with medical student, TN man steals laptops from college
65.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been arrested in Chennai for allegedly stealing laptops from medical college hostels to take revenge on his former girlfriend, a medical student, who broke up with him. The man has stolen 31 high-end laptops and has been making a living by selling them. He committed similar crimes in medical college hostels in Kerala, Delhi and Gujarat.

66.title: Who are the highest run-scorers in IPL 2022 after 20 matches?
66.article_body: Following the conclusion of the first 20 matches of IPL 2022, RR's Jos Buttler leads the list of highest run-getters with 218 runs from four innings. Buttler is the only batter to have scored a hundred in IPL 2022 so far. He is followed by LSG's Quinton De Kock (188 runs), GT's Shubman Gill (180) and MI's Ishan Kishan (175).

67.title: 10-yr-old activist Licypriya cleans waste on public ground after festival in Manipur
67.article_body: Manipur's 10-year-old environmental activist Licypriya Kangujam cleaned a public ground littered with plastic waste and bottles after the 'Yaoshang' festival celebrations in her village. The climate activist took to Twitter to share pictures of the ground before and after the collection of waste. "Yaoshang is over, but the battle against plastic waste isn't over," she told The Sangai Express.

68.title: 'The Kashmir Files' producers reunite for two more films
68.article_body: Following the success of 'The Kashmir Files', Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri, Pallavi Joshi and Abhishek Agarwal are coming together again to produce two more films. According to a video shared by Vivek, the films will show 'two brutally honest stories' from Indian history which will have 'spine-chilling truths'. 'The Kashmir Files' has earned ₹250.73 crore in India so far.

69.title: 2,200 men trying to leave Ukraine in breach of martial law detained
69.article_body: Ukraine's border agency has said that it has so far detained about 2,200 men of fighting age, who were trying to leave the country amid the war with Russia. Under Ukraine's martial law, men aged between 18 to 60 are prohibited from leaving the country. The agency said that the men had used forged documents and tried to bribe officials.

70.title: Ericsson indefinitely suspends its business in Russia
70.article_body: Telecom equipment maker Ericsson on Monday said it's suspending its business in Russia indefinitely. "In the light of recent events and of European Union sanctions, the company will now suspend its affected business with customers in Russia indefinitely," the Swedish firm said in a statement. Ericsson would record a $95 million provision for impairment of assets and other exceptional costs.

71.title: Destroyed S-300 anti-aircraft missile systems in Ukraine: Russia
71.article_body: Russia on Monday claimed to have destroyed S-300 anti-aircraft missile systems that it said was given to Ukraine by a European country. Russia's defence ministry said that its forces launched Kalibr missiles to destroy four S-300 launchers concealed in a hangar near the Dnipro city. It further claimed that 25 Ukrainian soldiers were hit in the attack.

72.title: When in power, don't treat farmers unfairly: Telangana CM
72.article_body: Amid the ongoing paddy procurement issue in the state, Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao said, "Is growing paddy Telangana farmers' fault?" "I warn PM Modi that you can't mess with farmers. Indian history is a testament that wherever farmers cried, government loses power. Nobody is permanent...When in power, don't treat farmers unfairly," Rao added.

73.title: Pak crisis won't affect its relations with Afghanistan: Taliban
73.article_body: Taliban government's Deputy Spokesperson Inamullah Samangani has said that the political crisis in Pakistan won't have "any particular impact" on its relations with Afghanistan, TOLO News reported. This comes after Imran Khan was ousted as Pakistan PM after losing a no-trust vote. Samangani added that the government "seeks good economic and political relations between the two countries".

74.title: Aryan Khan begins work on his web show; does test shoot in Mumbai: Reports
74.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan has reportedly begun work on his untitled web show. According to reports, Aryan will not just write but also direct the show. He also did a test shoot for his show, last week in Mumbai, reports added. Aryan had reportedly taken complete charge at the test shoot that took place on Friday and Saturday.

75.title: Ishaan Khatter shares pics from 'Pippa' sets, announces wrap
75.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter on Monday took to Instagram to share a series of pictures from the sets of his upcoming film 'Pippa' and announced a wrap of the shooting. He wrote in the caption, "Filled with gratitude for the experience of this film...Humbled and brimming with love. This is your Captain Balram Singh Mehta signing off from #Pippa."

76.title: Our bowling has been our biggest positive this season: DC's Kuldeep Yadav
76.article_body: DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav, who has picked 10 wickets in four games so far, has said their bowling has been their "biggest positive" this IPL season. "When we were bowling against MI in our first game, it looked like they'll score 200, but we restricted them to 177/5," recalled Kuldeep. DC won by 44 runs against KKR after posting 215/5.

77.title: Hyderabad police arrest burglar, recover items worth ₹32 lakh
77.article_body: A team of Hyderabad's LB Nagar Police Station arrested a habitual burglar, Jaganath (28), who has committed multiple inter-state offences. The police recovered items worth ₹32 lakh from the accused. Some of the recovered items are a Ford Figo car, mobile phones and 440 grams of gold ornaments, police said. Notably, the accused is a resident of Karnataka's Tumkur district.

78.title: Kashmir Files becomes 1st Hindi film to cross ₹250-cr mark post-pandemic
78.article_body: Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files' has become the first Hindi film to cross the ₹250-crore mark at the domestic box office since the COVID-19 pandemic began. The film, which was reportedly made on a budget of ₹15 crore, has collected ₹250.73 crore in India. 'The Kashmir Files' stars Anupam Kher, Pallavi Joshi and Darshan Kumaar among others in key roles.

79.title: Salman revived my career with Race 3; lot of people started noticing me: Bobby
79.article_body: Bobby Deol said Salman Khan revived his career with 'Race 3'. "Salman gave me an opportunity in 'Race 3' and that was the beginning of...lot of things for me...People saw me after a long time," he added. "Because of Race 3, I landed a role in 'Housefull 3' and that's how the younger generation started noticing me," Bobby said.

80.title: He's a player with destructive batting: Rahul on Stoinis' 38* vs RR
80.article_body: Praising Marcus Stoinis for his "destructive batting" after he made his LSG debut against RR in IPL 2022, LSG captain KL Rahul said his teammate has lot of power and can win matches for them from any position. The all-rounder scored a 17-ball 38* in his side's three-run loss to RR on Sunday. LSG have three wins from five matches.

81.title: Cyber police busts job racket in Noida; 5 women among 10 arrested
81.article_body: The cyber police team has arrested 10 people, including five women, for running a fake call centre in Noida duping people on the pretext of providing them jobs. The gang, which had two main accused, cheated over 100 people in the last four months. The call centre was raided after a woman, who was cheated of ₹10,900, lodged a complaint.

82.title: ED questions Congress' Mallikarjun Kharge in National Herald case
82.article_body: Enforcement Directorate on Monday questioned Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge in connection with a money laundering probe linked to the National Herald case. BJP's Subramanian Swamy had in a Delhi court filed a complaint against Congress' Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, their companies and associated persons. Leaders Motilal Vora and Oscar Fernandes were also named.

83.title: 4 Sri Ram Sena members held in K'taka for vandalising Muslim fruit vendor's shop
83.article_body: Karnataka Police on Monday arrested four members of Sri Ram Sena for allegedly vandalising a fruit shop owned by a Muslim vendor in the Dharwad district of Karnataka. Police have lodged an FIR against eight persons on charges of deliberately hurting religious sentiments, unlawful assembly, rioting, and deliberate attempt to breach of peace.

84.title: Which platform can ever pull this off?: Paytm CEO on Bezos-Musk Twitter exchange
84.article_body: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos supported Tesla CEO Elon Musk's idea of starting a homeless shelter at Twitter's San Francisco headquarters. Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma reacted to the exchange and said, "Jeff joins Elon on Twitter. Which platform in the world can ever pull this off?" Bezos said a portion of the headquarters can be converted.

85.title: Ranbir Kapoor to play a therapist in Luv Ranjan's film: Report
85.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor will play the role of a therapist in Luv Ranjan's upcoming film, according to a report. "He will be playing the role of a therapist who [specialises] in solving relationship problems of people," Bollywood Hungama said quoting a source. The yet-untitled film also stars Shraddha Kapoor, Dimple Kapadia and Boney Kapoor.

86.title: Won't attack Mariupol only, will take Kyiv too: Chechen chief
86.article_body: The leader of Russia's republic of Chechnya, Ramzan Kadyrov, has said that Russian forces will not just attack Ukraine's Mariupol, but also take the capital Kyiv. "There will be an offensive... not only on Mariupol," he said. "Luhansk and Donetsk - we will fully liberate in the first place... and then take Kyiv and all other cities," he added.

87.title: Austrian leader to meet Putin amid Ukraine crisis, says war 'must stop'
87.article_body: Austrian Chancellor Karl Nehammer has said that he will meet Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow on Monday. Nehammer added that while Austria is militarily neutral, it has a clear stance on Ukraine conflict which "must stop", adding need for humanitarian corridors. Notably, Nehammer's meeting would be the first in-person interaction between Putin and a European Union leader since invasion.

88.title: Pratik, Patralekhaa to star in Jyotirao Phule-Savitribai Phule's biopic
88.article_body: Actors Pratik Gandhi and Patralekhaa will essay the roles of social activists, Mahatma Jyotirao Govindrao Phule and his wife Savitribai Phule respectively in the biopic 'Phule'. On the 195th birth anniversary of Jyotiba Phule, the makers of 'Phule' revealed the first look of the film. Helmed by National Award-winning director Ananth Mahadevan, the film will have a worldwide release.

89.title: Rakesh Tikait joins TRS protest in Delhi on paddy procurement issue
89.article_body: BKU leader Rakesh Tikait on Monday joined the ongoing protest by TRS at the Telangana Bhavan in Delhi against the alleged "discriminatory policy" of procurement of foodgrains. Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao is leading the protest. "Our farmers are not getting the right price. We request the Central government to procure paddy from our state," TRS MLC K Kavitha said.

90.title: WhatsApp to show estimated time of arrival for file sharing: Report
90.article_body: A new WhatsApp feature will let users understand when a document is fully downloaded on their devices or uploaded to their servers, WABetaInfo reported. On uploading a document, a new label showing the estimated time of arrival appears in the chat bubble, under the document name. The feature has been released on WhatsApp beta for Android and iOS.

91.title: 1 killed, 25 injured as speeding car hits bus, making it skid on its side in Pune
91.article_body: A driver of a Swift car was killed and 25 passengers of a bus were injured when the car rammed into the bus coming from the opposite direction on the Pune-Ahmednagar highway, police said. The bus turned and skidded on its side before crashing into parked vehicles due to the collision. The accident was partially captured in a CCTV camera.

92.title: 3 of same family die by suicide in Kerala's Kochi over mounting debt
92.article_body: Three members of the same family allegedly died by suicide in Kerala's Kochi due to mounting debt, police said. The deceased's bodies were found by children in the family when they woke up on Monday morning, following which they alerted their neighbours about the incident. According to police, the family operated a flour mill and had allegedly incurred heavy losses.

93.title: Jada Pinkett Smith makes first appearance since Will Smith's Oscar slap
93.article_body: Actress Jada Pinkett Smith made her first public appearance on Saturday since her husband Will Smith slapped Chris Rock at the Oscars. She attended the opening of the Rhimes Performing Arts Center in Los Angeles and posed alongside television producer Shonda Rhimes and actress Debbie Allen. Jada also shared a picture of posing on the red carpet with the two.

94.title: No need to panic about the new XE coronavirus variant: NTAGI chief
94.article_body: National Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation (NTAGI) chief Dr NK Arora on Monday said there is no need to panic about the new XE variant of coronavirus. Omicron variants of the X series are not causing serious diseases and do not show a very rapid spread, Dr Arora said. "These variants will keep on occurring," he added.

95.title: Gurugram society residents protest 2 months after ceiling collapse
95.article_body: A group of apartment owners of Gurugram's Chintels Paradiso held silent protests on Sunday at various government offices two months after collapse of multiple ceilings in a building in the residential society. The group said they wanted to highlight the fact that little to no progress had been made regarding the CBI probe, structural audit and compensation to buyers.

96.title: Kanye looking for 'behavioural treatment' at luxury facility: Report
96.article_body: Kanye West is looking for "behavioural treatment" to "be a better human and better dad" for his four kids with ex-wife Kim Kardashian, reported Page Six. As per the report, he is "going away to get help" and his team is looking for places with a luxury component. This comes after Kanye's online harassment of Kim and boyfriend Pete Davidson.

97.title: Over 15,000 have signed up for govt’s yoga programme: Delhi govt
97.article_body: The Delhi government's 'Dilli Ki Yogshala', an initiative to provide free yoga training on demand in neighbourhoods, has seen over 15,000 enrolments since its launch in December last year, an official said. Around 9,500 people are getting trained in yoga every day and Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal announced in January that it would be available online for COVID-19 patients.

98.title: NITI Aayog ranks states on energy efficiency, Gujarat tops among larger states
98.article_body: NITI Aayog has released rankings for the State Energy and Climate Index (SECI) Round 1 and Gujarat has ranked first among larger states. It was followed by Kerala and Punjab, while Chhattisgarh, Madhya Pradesh and Jharkhand were placed at the bottom. Among smaller states, Goa topped the index which ranks states on energy efficiency, sustainability and four other parameters.

99.title: 40 e-scooters of Jitendra EV catch fire in a truck in Nashik, no casualties reported
99.article_body: As many as 40 electric scooters of Jitendra Electric Vehicles (Jitendra EV) caught fire on Monday after being loaded in a transport container in Nashik. The company said that the incident took place near its factory and no casualties have been reported. Jitendra EV is conducting an investigation to find the root cause of the fire.

100.title: Lost a lot of weight while shooting for Ali's action film: Shahid
100.article_body: Shahid Kapoor, speaking about his upcoming action film with director Ali Abbas Zafar, said it's a departure from the "typical" action movies. "It's a kind of action...I've not done before...It's an edgy action, it has...quirk to it," he added. Shahid further said doing action is very tiring, adding that he lost a lot of weight while shooting for the film.

101.title: Delhi's Museum of Prime Ministers to be inaugurated on Thursday
101.article_body: The Pradhan Mantri Sangrahalaya, or the Museum of Prime Ministers, is all set to be inaugurated on Thursday at the Teen Murti complex in New Delhi. The space recognises contributions of all 14 former PMs irrespective of ideology or tenure, officials of the Ministry of Culture said. The museum houses some personal items, gifts and memorabilia related to the PMs.

102.title: TN Assembly passes resolution against CUET, BJP walks out
102.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Assembly adopted a resolution urging the Centre to withdraw the proposal to conduct Common University Entrance Test (CUET) for admission in central varsities. The resolution was supported by all the parties including the main opposition AIADMK. However, BJP staged a walkout. The resolution claimed that CUET "will sideline the diverse school education systems across the country".

103.title: Maha BJP chief asks Congress to prove its Hindutva credentials
103.article_body: Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil asked Congress to prove its Hindutva credentials by announcing that it welcomes the abrogation of Article 370. He was addressing a press conference after campaigning for BJP candidate for Kolhapur North Assembly bypoll. "If they want to preserve Hindutva in Kolhapur, then Congress should announce that it welcomes the removal of Article 370," Patil said.

104.title: Violence won't be tolerated: JNU as students clash over non-veg food
104.article_body: JNU on Monday said no violence will be tolerated on the campus, a day after some students were injured in a clash between two groups allegedly over serving chicken for dinner on Ram Navami. JNU urged students to maintain peace. An FIR was registered on a complaint filed by members of JNUSU, SFI, DSF and AISA against unknown ABVP students.

105.title: Whatever the result is, we're going to protect our environment: MI's Zaheer
105.article_body: MI's Director of Cricket Zaheer Khan has said whatever the result is this IPL season, they're going to protect their team environment. "You've got to be able to close those moments of the game where the momentum is shifting. We have...not been able to do that," he added. So far, MI are winless in their four games this season.

106.title: Teen dies after gangrape at TMC leader's son's party in WB; 'forcibly cremated'
106.article_body: A teenage girl died after being allegedly gang-raped at the birthday party of the son of a TMC panchayat member in West Bengal's Nadia. The girl's mother alleged that a group of people forcibly took her body for cremation before her death certificate was issued. Police, however, said the family cremated her. The TMC leader's son has been arrested.

107.title: Aishwarya orders room service for me, else I don't eat: Abhishek Bachchan
107.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan in an interview has revealed that he has certain quirks including having a problem speaking to strangers on the phone. He added that during outdoor shoots, he can't call room service and his wife actress Aishwarya Rai calls room service to order food for him. "Otherwise she knows I won't eat. I have this issue," Abhishek said.

108.title: Amid rising fuel costs, Hyd techie designs 7-seater 'pedal car'
108.article_body: Amid rising fuel costs, a Hyderabad-based techie, Pranav Upadhyay, has designed community 'pedal car' for intracity commutes. The vehicle can accommodate seven people, five of whom can pedal car, while two seats are designed for differently-abled people. Upadhyay said that he seeks to combat air pollution through this initiative, adding that he'll design a more sustainable version of car soon.

109.title: 1 killed, 25 injured as car hits passenger bus on Pune-Ahmednagar highway
109.article_body: One person was killed and at least 25 others were injured after a speeding vehicle hit a passenger bus coming from the opposite side on the Pune-Ahmednagar highway late Sunday night. After the accident, the bus skidded off the road and hit three vehicles parked in front of a hotel. The car driver died on the spot.

110.title: I want to turn Prithvi Shaw into a player who plays over 100 Tests: Ponting
110.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting has said their opener Prithvi Shaw has as much talent as he had if not more and he wants to turn the 22-year-old into a player who plays over 100 Tests. In their four matches in IPL 2022, Prithvi has scored 38, 10, 61 and 51 runs. Last season, Prithvi had scored 479 runs.

111.title: Farhan shares BTS clips from Rishi Kapoor's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen'
111.article_body: Director-Actor Farhan Akhtar shared behind-the-scenes (BTS) clips from late actor Rishi Kapoor's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen'. Alongside the post, he wrote, "Best moments served with love from the sets of #SharmajiNamkeen." Commenting on the post, actor Ronit Roy wrote, "Much senior to me but [he was] one of the best friends I had in the industry. I miss him."

112.title: UP govt's Twitter handle gets hacked, tweets on NFT trading posted
112.article_body: The official Twitter account of the Uttar Pradesh government was hacked on Monday morning, two days after UP CM Yogi Adityanath's Twitter handle was also hacked. The tweets posted by the hackers were related to cryptocurrencies and NFTs and were deleted after the account was restored. They also tagged a number of random accounts in subsequent tweets.

113.title: Punjab Congress' Twitter account gets hacked, location changed to 'Metaverse'
113.article_body: Punjab Congress' official Twitter account was hacked on Monday as their timeline was spammed with random users being tagged. The location of the account was also changed from 'Chandigarh' to 'Metaverse'. Recently, some of the prominent Twitter accounts including the Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister's Office and the University Grants Commission were hacked for a while by the miscreants.

114.title: Pic shows RK Studios decked up with lights ahead of Ranbir-Alia's reported wedding
114.article_body: A picture has surfaced online showing RK Studios in Chembur being decked up with lights ahead of Ranbir Kapoor-Alia Bhatt's reported wedding. On Sunday, visuals of Ranbir Kapoor’s under-construction house in Bandra surfaced online, showing the building being decorated with LED string lights. Alia's half brother Rahul Bhatt had earlier confirmed that the wedding is happening.

115.title: Jeff Bezos responds to Musk's poll to turn Twitter HQ into a homeless shelter
115.article_body: Jeff Bezos, Amazon Founder and the world's second-richest person, responded to a poll by the world's richest man, Elon Musk, on whether Twitter's San Francisco headquarters should be converted into a homeless shelter. "Or do portion. Worked out great and makes it easy for employees who want to volunteer," Bezos tweeted to Musk. Elon Musk responded "Great idea" to Bezos.

116.title: Rape destroys soul: Court on Mumbai attempted gang-rape case
116.article_body: A special POCSO court sentenced a 28-year-old man to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment for attempting to gang-rape a 15-year-old mentally challenged girl in Mumbai. The court observed that rape is "more heinous" than murder as it "destroys the soul" of the woman. The girl had reportedly told her mother that the accused had tried to lure her with ₹10.

117.title: Let's tune out noise, stay focused: Twitter CEO as Musk turns down board seat
117.article_body: After Elon Musk turned down the offer to join Twitter's board of directors, the company's CEO Parag Agrawal told his team, "Let's tune out the noise and stay focused on the work." He added, "There will be distractions ahead but our goals and priorities remain unchanged." Musk's appointment was "contingent on a background check and formal acceptance", Agrawal said.

118.title: She has been trolled & mocked: Neha on why she chose Rashami for her song Parwah
118.article_body: Speaking about her song 'Parwah', which also stars actress Rashami Desai, singer and ex-Bigg Boss OTT contestant, Neha Bhasin said, "I wrote the song after 'Bigg Boss OTT'. I was angry at that time...It started from...being misunderstood." "Then I met Rashami and thought, why not feature her because...she’s also been trolled a lot and mocked by the world," Neha added.

119.title: Ghaziabad school shut after 2 students test COVID-19 positive
119.article_body: A private school in UP's Ghaziabad was closed for three days after two students tested positive for COVID-19. In a letter to parents, the Principal said that the school management has decided to suspend offline classes from April 11 to 13 in order to break the infection chain. "We will continue imparting education through online classes," added the Principal.

120.title: 9 arrested over clashes in Guj's Khambat; Section 144 imposed in Himmatnagar
120.article_body: Police have arrested nine persons for their alleged involvement in communal violence and stone-pelting incidents during a Ram Navami procession in Khambhat city of Gujarat's Anand district, officials said. Additionally, Section 144 of the CrPC has been imposed in Sabarkantha district's Himmatnagar, where communal clashes were also reported. The prohibitory order will remain in force till April 13.

121.title: CPI MP urges PM to provide free COVID-19 vaccine booster doses
121.article_body: CPI MP Binoy Viswam has written a letter to PM Narendra Modi urging him to provide COVID-19 vaccine booster doses for free at public healthcare institutions. Criticising Centre's move to allow only private vaccination centres to administer paid booster shots to adults above 18 years, Viswam said that the privatisation of the vaccination drive is ill-planned and disastrous.

122.title: Apple starts making iPhone 13 in India
122.article_body: Apple confirmed that the company's manufacturing partner Foxconn has started assembling the iPhone 13 at its plant near Chennai. Foxconn also makes the iPhone 12 and iPhone 11 in India. "We are excited to begin making iPhone 13...right here in India for our local customers," Apple said.

123.title: Groom among 3 injured in celebratory firing in Raj; shooter accidentally kills self
123.article_body: A man, named in 13 criminal cases, injured three persons in celebratory firing, before accidentally shooting himself with his country-made pistol at a wedding function in Rajasthan's Sikar district, according to police. The groom, who sustained injuries, is also a criminal and is named in several cases. Five persons have been taken into custody for questioning, police added.

124.title: Actress Pranitha Subhash announces pregnancy, shares pics of ultrasound
124.article_body: Actress Pranitha Subhash took to Instagram to announce that she's expecting her first child with her husband Nithin Raju, who's a Bengaluru-based businessman. Pranitha, who appears in Kannada, Tamil, Telugu and Hindi movies, shared pictures of ultrasound with her over five million followers on Instagram. She wrote, "For my husband's 34th bday, the angels above have a present for us."

125.title: 16 women die after delivery every month in Delhi's 4 major govt hospitals: RTI
125.article_body: Around 16 women die after childbirth every month in four major government hospitals in Delhi, as per information released by hospitals under the Right to Information (RTI) Act. According to the information received, 1,281 women died after childbirth between January 2015 and September 2021 at AIIMS Delhi, Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital (RML), Safdarjung Hospital and Sucheta Kriplani Hospital

126.title: Names of 6 aides of ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan added to 'stop list': Report
126.article_body: The names of six key aides of ousted Pakistan PM Imran Khan have been put on the 'stop list' by the FIA to prevent them from leaving the country, reports said. Khan's former principal secretary Azam Khan, ex-special assistant on political communication Shahbaz Gill and ex-adviser on interior and accountability Shahzad Akbar were reportedly added to the list.

127.title: Harshest action against Khargone rioters; will make them pay for damages: MP CM
127.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Monday termed the clashes in Khargone as "unfortunate" and said the harshest action will be taken against rioters, who have been identified. "Action doesn't mean only sending the offenders to jail. They'll be made to pay for the damage to public and private property," he added. "We're forming a 'Claims Tribunal'," Chouhan said.

128.title: Thar is Harsh Varrdhan's first film as producer; he's passionate about it: Anil
128.article_body: Speaking about his son Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor's first film as a producer, Anil Kapoor said Harsh Varrdhan has a unique approach and his choices of films are distinct. "[He's]...passionate about the project and he played an integral part in this film coming together," Anil added. "'Thar' is an experience and I can't wait for audiences to watch it!" Anil said.

129.title: Tiger found dead in Madhya Pradesh, 5th death in fortnight
129.article_body: A tiger was found dead at Pench Tiger Reserve (PTR) in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district on Sunday. Officials suspect that the tiger, which was around two years old, was killed by another feline during a territorial fight. Five tigers have died so far since March 29 in Madhya Pradesh which reportedly has the highest number of tigers among all states.

130.title: Drunk man falls asleep in car in middle of Mumbai road causing traffic jam, held
130.article_body: A 34-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly stopping his car in the middle of a road in Mumbai's Borivali West and falling asleep in the vehicle, causing a traffic jam, police said. A police officer went up to the driver, woke him up and questioned him about his errant behaviour. Police added that the man was reeking of alcohol.

131.title: Never expected to get both Chahal, Ashwin in auction: RR's Sangakkara
131.article_body: RR's Director of Cricket Kumar Sangakkara has said they never expected to get both Yuzvendra Chahal and Ravichandran Ashwin in the auction. "I think they're the best two spinners going around so far...we're lucky and fortunate to have them and all we're trying to do is support them to get better," he added. Chahal picked four wickets against LSG.

132.title: Ded: Alia Bhatt on YouTuber recreating 'Kabir Singh' scene over reports of her wedding
132.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt took to Instagram to react to YouTuber Be YouNick recreating a scene from 'Kabir Singh' with reference to Alia's wedding with Ranbir Kapoor. In the video, the YouTuber can be seen running behind a car which had a placard behind it reading "Alia weds Ranbir." "Ded," Alia wrote commenting on the video.

133.title: I'm a firm believer in God; I go to church, temple, dargah: Vijay
133.article_body: Actor Vijay, during a recent interview, said that he respects all religions. "I'm a firm believer. I go to church, I've gone to temples and Ameen Peer Dargah during the filming of Thuppakki," he said, adding, "My mother is...Hindu and my father is Christian...I grew up in...household that never restricted me as to where I should go or shouldn't go."

134.title: Shahid's 'Jersey' postponed, film avoids clash with 'K.G.F: Chapter 2'
134.article_body: Shahid Kapoor-starrer 'Jersey', which was scheduled to release on April 14, has been postponed by a week. The Gowtam Tinnanuri directorial will now release in theatres on April 22, producer Aman Gill said. The sports drama has avoided the box office clash with Yash and Sanjay Dutt-starrer 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' and Vijay's action-thriller movie 'Beast'.

135.title: Prithvi took on the bowlers, we were clueless at that point: Shreyas
135.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer has said that they were "clueless" when DC opener Prithvi Shaw took on the bowlers during their match on Sunday, which they lost by 44 runs. "Prithvi can change the game in the powerplay...he hits good shots and...I [couldn't] figure out how to set the field for him," added Shreyas. Prithvi scored 51(29) in the game.

136.title: Man flashes, makes obscene gestures at girl in Pune; booked
136.article_body: A man has been booked for allegedly flashing and making obscene gestures at a girl who was on her way to attend a class on Pune's Tilak road. The incident had occurred in January, but the girl filed a complaint on Sunday as she was apparently in a state of shock. The accused had also reportedly stalked the girl.

137.title: 27-year-old man abused, extorted after contacting 'escort service' in Mumbai
137.article_body: A 27-year-old man was allegedly abused and extorted after he contacted an escort service to enquire about the rates for massages in Mumbai. The complainant was also threatened by the unidentified accused that a photo of the former's wife will be uploaded on an adult website, police said. The complainant alleged that ₹1,000 was extorted from him by the accused.

138.title: Man rapes sister's 15-yr-old friend in B'luru; shares video with friends
138.article_body: A 20-year-old man and his five friends, including two minors, have been arrested on charges of allegedly raping and sexually abusing his sister's 15-year-old female friend in Bengaluru. The man had reportedly recorded a video of raping the girl and shared it with the others. The man's friends had apparently then used it to sexually harass and extort the girl.

139.title: N Korea celebrates 10 years of 'gifted thinker' Kim Jong Un's rule
139.article_body: North Korea celebrated 10 years of its ruler Kim Jong Un's leadership on Monday. The government praised his political achievements and unveiled new portraits and exhibitions on the occasion. A senior official called Kim "a gifted thinker and theoretician, outstanding statesman and peerlessly great commander" and praised him for making the country "a full-fledged military power".

140.title: Ded: Alia Bhatt on YouTuber recreating 'Kabir Singh' scene over reports of her wedding
140.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt took to Instagram to react to YouTuber Be YouNick recreating a scene from 'Kabir Singh' with reference to Alia's wedding with Ranbir Singh. In the video, the YouTuber can be seen running behind a car which had a placard behind it reading "Alia weds Ranbir." "Ded," Alia wrote commenting on the video.

141.title: 2 killed, 10 wounded in nightclub shooting in US' Iowa
141.article_body: A shooting inside a nightclub left a man and a woman dead and 10 people wounded in US' Iowa on Sunday, authorities said. Cedar Rapids Police Chief Wayne Jerman said investigators believe two men fired more than a dozen shots inside Taboo Nightclub and Lounge just before 1:30 am Sunday. Police are searching for suspects and no arrests were reported.

142.title: 2 dead, 48 stuck midair for 16 hrs after J'khand's ropeway cable car collision
142.article_body: At least two people died and several sustained injuries after some cable cars in a ropeway collided with each other due to a technical snag at Trikut Pahar in Jharkhand's Deoghar on Sunday. According to officials, 48 people are still stuck in at least 12 cabins. Teams of Indian Air Force (IAF) and NDRF have been deployed for rescue operation.

143.title: David Beckham's son Brooklyn, actress Nicola Peltz share pics from their wedding
143.article_body: Former England football team captain David Beckham's eldest son Brooklyn Beckham and actress Nicola Peltz took to Instagram to share pictures from their wedding. The couple got married in Palm Beach in US' Florida last weekend. "This was amazing to experience...you guys are beautiful," singer Lloyiso commented on one of the pictures.

144.title: Shanghai to lift lockdown in some areas despite COVID-19 surge
144.article_body: Even as over 25,000 new COVID-19 cases were recorded in China's Shanghai on Sunday, the authorities have decided to lift the lockdown in some areas. According to an official, the city has been classified into three risk categories. He said that as many as 7,565 "prevention areas" will be reopened after two weeks without a positive case.

145.title: Anushka to shoot for 'Chakda 'Xpress' at Lord's Cricket Ground: Report
145.article_body: Anushka Sharma will reportedly shoot for 'Chakda 'Xpress' at the Lord's Cricket Ground in London.  The actress, who'll portray cricketer Jhulan Goswami in the upcoming biopic, is also expected to shoot at Headingley Stadium, the report stated. "Anushka is expected to shoot at...a few other big...stadiums. It looks like...she'll travel to at least four big stadiums," a source told Pinkvilla.

146.title: 40-yr-old woman held for misbehaving with police in Chandigarh
146.article_body: A 40-year-old woman was arrested for misbehaving with police officers at Manimajra Police Station, Chandigarh. The accused and her father allegedly abused an officer and recorded their interaction with the family. Police officers said the station has CCTV cameras and asked her to stop recording, following which she misbehaved with one of the woman Assistant Sub-Inspectors and injured her.

147.title: 10 students in auto-rickshaw injured after being hit by truck in Pune
147.article_body: At least 10 school children and a driver of an auto-rickshaw were injured after being hit by a mini-truck while they were on their way to their school in Pune's Uruli Kanchan area. According to the police, the injured students are aged between seven to 12 years and only a few of them including the driver have sustained serious injuries.

148.title: Kuldeep executed it well vs Stoinis and he's only going to get better: Boult
148.article_body: RR pacer Trent Boult praised his fellow pacer Kuldeep Sen for defending 15 runs in the final over against LSG, stating that the 25-year-old is only going to get better in the upcoming games. "Kuldeep executed it well [against Marcus Stoinis]," stated Boult. With Marcus Stoinis on strike, Kuldeep bowled three dot balls and conceded only 11 in final over.

149.title: Nadabet project will give employment to 5 lakh youth in 10 years: Amit Shah
149.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, who inaugurated the border viewing point on the India-Pakistan international border in Gujarat's Nadabet, said the pilot project will provide employment to over five lakh youth in next 10 years. "I pay my homage to PM Narendra Modi's vision for he had come up with the idea of a multidimensional project for Nadabet," Shah added.

150.title: Hong Kong Customs seizes record methamphetamine haul worth ₹387 cr
150.article_body: Hong Kong Customs said on Sunday that it has seized a record haul of methamphetamine worth HK$400 million (approximately ₹387 cr) and arrested two men in the matter. About 447 kg of the suspected drug was hidden in three transformers, while the rest was found at a logistics warehouse in 10 pieces of industrial-use anti-vibratory rubber, it added.

151.title: Big B reunites with co-star Nafisa Ali for Uunchai; fan says 'Beautiful jodi'
151.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan reunited with his 'Major Saab' co-star Nafisa Ali Sodhi for his upcoming project 'Uunchai'. The two played a married couple in the 1998 film which also starred Ajay Devgn. Sharing pictures with Amitabh, Nafisa wrote, "My...handsome, amazing man...and adorable co-star Amitabh Bachchan." She also shared a throwback picture of them from 'Major Saab', and wrote, "How time flies."

152.title: Unfortunate that people in power promoted 'The Kashmir Files': Pawar
152.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said it is "unfortunate" that people in power promoted 'The Kashmir Files' movie. "An individual made a movie (The Kashmir Files) showing atrocities on Hindus," Pawar added. "It depicted that in Kashmir, the Hindu Pandits were minorities and they were driven out during VP Singh-led government which was supported by BJP," Pawar stated.

153.title: Mysterious creature with human-like lips washes up on Australian beach, pic surfaces
153.article_body: A mysterious creature with human-like lips washed up on Bondi Beach in Australia. A jogger posted a video on Facebook of the creature and asked people to help him identify it. The jogger said that the animal appeared to be nearly half a metre long and had lips like a human and skin like a shark.

154.title: Musk tweets emoji with hand on mouth after Twitter CEO says he won't join Board
154.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared a laughing emoji with hand on mouth on Twitter about an hour after Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal announced that Musk has decided not to join its Board. Musk, who is Twitter's biggest shareholder, later deleted the tweet. Agrawal said that Twitter will value input from its shareholders, whether or not they are on the Board.

155.title: 1 killed, another injured in Gujarat during clashes amid Ram Navami procession
155.article_body: One person died and another sustained injuries after communal clashes broke out in Gujarat's Khambhat during a Ram Navami procession on Sunday. "The body of an unidentified man, who appears to be aged around 65 years, was recovered from the spot...where two groups pelted stones at each other," an officer said. A few shop cabins were also set on fire.

156.title: 29-yr-old man dies after being hit by BEST bus in Mumbai, driver held
156.article_body: An employee at an IT company was killed after allegedly being hit by a BEST bus in Mumbai's Mankhurd area. The driver was arrested but was later granted bail by a magistrate court, police said. The deceased Karan Dumbre (29) was going to his home on his motorcycle when the accident took place, officials from the Trombay Police Station said.

157.title: Bank manager among 4 held for stealing valuables worth ₹2.5 cr from lockers in UP
157.article_body: Four persons, including a bank manager, were arrested in connection with an alleged theft of valuables worth over ₹2.5 crore from the lockers of the Central Bank of India's Karachi Khana branch in Kanpur, police said on Sunday. Stolen ornaments weighing 342 grams have been recovered from the accused, Deputy Commissioner of Police (East), Pramod Kumar, said.

158.title: Wanted Sarfaraz for the end, that's why we sent Axar, Shardul over him: Pant
158.article_body: On being asked why Sarfaraz Khan wasn't sent in to bat after the fall of the fifth wicket against KKR, DC captain Rishabh Pant said they wanted the 24-year-old for the end of the innings. "We wanted momentum to keep going...we knew [even] if we lost wickets...we'd have Sarfaraz...and that's why we sent Axar and Shardul over him," explained Pant.

159.title: Ram Navami processions attacked in Howrah, Bankura: WB leaders
159.article_body: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari on Sunday alleged that a Ram Navami procession was attacked by police in Howrah, saying, "Can't Sanatani devotees practice their religion in this state safely?" In another incident, Union Minister and state Lok Sabha MP Subhas Sarkar also claimed that a Ram Navami procession and his car were pelted with stones in Bankura.

160.title: Sec 144 imposed in village in J'khand's Lohardaga after communal violence
160.article_body: Communal clashes were reported in at least two districts of Jharkhand during Ram Navami processions on Sunday evening. In view of incidents of stone-pelting and arson, Section 144 of the CrPC has been imposed in Hirdi village of Lohardaga district, Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM) Arbind Kumar Lal said. Another instance of communal violence was reported in Bermo area of Bokaro district.

161.title: Queen Elizabeth II chats with COVID patients, staff at UK hospital
161.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II paid a virtual visit to a hospital in London and interacted with COVID-19 patients, doctors and nurses. The event marked the official opening of the Queen Elizabeth Unit, a critical care facility housing 155 beds. "It [COVID-19] does leave one very tired and exhausted, doesn't it?" the Queen told a couple recovering from the infection.

162.title: I once took up the role of Sita in Ramlila: Ravi Kishan
162.article_body: Actor-politician Ravi Kishan has said that he struggled for many years and played a lot of roles before achieving some level of success. He added that he even took up the role of Sita in Ramlila "for the sake of pursuing [his] passion for acting". Ravi further said his father didn't support him initially but his mother always supported him.

163.title: A RRRemarkable milestone: Ajay as 'RRR' crosses ₹1,000-cr mark globally
163.article_body: After 'RRR' crossed the ₹1,000-crore mark at the global box office, Ajay Devgn took to Twitter to congratulate the team of the action-drama film. "A RRRemarkable Milestone! Congratulations to the entire team of #RRR for a record-breaking run at box office," Ajay, who played a character named Venkata Rama Raju in the film, wrote. 'RRR' was released on March 25.

164.title: Lakhs of people come out in streets in support of Imran Khan in Pakistan
164.article_body: Lakhs of people across Pakistan came out in streets in support of ousted PM Imran Khan on Sunday. Khan tweeted a video from Lahore and wrote, "Never have such crowds come out so spontaneously and in such numbers in our history, rejecting the imported govt led by crooks." Protests also took place in Karachi, Peshawar, Islamabad, Rawalpindi and Abbottabad.

165.title: Macron to face Marine Le Pen in presidential election in France
165.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron is set to face candidate Marine Le Pen in the presidential election runoff scheduled to be held on April 24. They emerged as the top two candidates after the first round of voting for the presidential election. Notably, Le Pen has called for banning hijab in public and halal butchers.

166.title: Earlier did some films to make my husband happy; I was like a chamchi: Neetu
166.article_body: Neetu Kapoor revealed earlier she did some films because of her husband, late actor Rishi Kapoor. She said, "There were films that I did with my husband and I was like a chamchi, he'd say 'come and do it'. I wouldn't do it on my own will." "I was doing (all that) trying to make my husband happy," she added.

167.title: War wouldn't have happened if Ukraine was in NATO: Ukraine minister
167.article_body: Ukraine Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba during an interview with NBC News said that the war with Russia wouldn't have taken place if the former country was "a member of NATO". He added that the "strategic mistake" by Germany and France in 2008, when they rejected US and its allies' efforts on the same, is "something that Ukraine is paying for".

168.title: Gujarat's education system is crumbling, says Arvind Kejriwal
168.article_body: AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal said that the people in Gujarat have begun to question the "crumbling education" system in the state being ruled by BJP for the last 27 years. Kejriwal promised that his party will provide just as "good education" to the students there as it is available in Delhi if voted to power in the upcoming polls.

169.title: Opposition is weak, BJP hammering it through probe agencies: Raut
169.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has accused the BJP-led Centre of "hammering the opposition through central investigative agencies" which already is "weak". "Despite this, the opposition is not ready to surrender," Raut said. "The weak opposition is being hammered...and our HM (Amit) Shah says, they want to see a strong opposition! This joke is interesting," added Raut.

170.title: Muslims offer water bottles in Ram Navami procession in Siliguri
170.article_body: Muslim youths in West Bengal's Siliguri offered water bottles and hugged participants of a Ram Navami procession on Sunday. One of the Muslim volunteers said that they had done so to "foster affection among the people of different communities". "It is a nice gesture that they came forward to greet us on the occasion," a participant of the procession said.

171.title: 6 workers killed as blast at chemical factory triggers fire in Gujarat's Bharuch
171.article_body: Six workers were killed after a blast at a chemical factory in Gujarat's Bharuch district triggered a fire on Monday early morning. Bharuch SP Leena Patil said the victims were working near a reactor, which suddenly exploded during solvent distillation process. "The victims' bodies were later recovered and sent for postmortem. The fire was also brought under control," she added.

172.title: India reports 861 new COVID-19 cases, 6 deaths in 24 hours
172.article_body: India has reported 861 new COVID-19 cases, 929 recoveries and six more deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country reported 1,054 COVID-19 cases and 29 deaths. India's active caseload currently stands at 11,058, while the death toll reached 5,21,691.

173.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read after 20 matches?
173.article_body: After the first 20 matches of IPL 2022, RR, KKR, GT, RCB and LSG have accumulated six points each. RR are on top of the table due to a superior net run-rate. GT are the only unbeaten team in the tournament so far, while defending champions CSK and five-time champions MI are yet to win a match.

174.title: 2 arrested for selling adulterated ghee in Delhi
174.article_body: The Delhi Police have arrested two people for allegedly selling adulterated ghee. The police said they recovered over 1,200 litres of adulterated ghee in packages of different brands. The matter came to light when a ghee manufacturing firm complained that some people were tampering with packets of the company's original product and adding fake ghee to them.

175.title: Shreyas Iyer's wicket was very important for me: Kuldeep on 4/35 vs KKR
175.article_body: DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav, who picked four wickets against KKR during their match on Sunday, has said KKR captain Shreyas Iyer's wicket was "personally very important" for him. "Shreyas was batting well and I wanted to make him guess. It was a very big wicket," he added. Apart from Shreyas, Kuldeep dismissed Pat Cummins, Sunil Narine and Umesh Yadav.

176.title: Fire destroys 200 acres of standing wheat crop in Haryana's Karnal
