352.title: Shehbaz Sharif nominated as new Pakistan PM by country's Opposition
352.article_body: The Leader of Opposition in the National Assembly of Pakistan, Shehbaz Sharif, has been nominated as the next PM of the country after Imran Khan was dismissed as Pakistan's PM on Sunday. Sharif is the president of the Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) party. Khan became the first Pakistani PM to lose the no-trust vote in Parliament.

353.title: Italian Embassy counsellor robbed off her handbag in Delhi; 2 arrested
353.article_body: A 54-year-old counsellor working at the Italian Embassy was robbed of her handbag by unidentified persons at Delhi's Barapullah flyover. The victim was heading home in an auto from her office when one of the accused robbed her of her handbag containing her phone, ID cards, debit cards and gold jewellery. Police have arrested two persons in this connection.

354.title: 26-year-old man arrested for invading pitch and giving fist bumps to Kohli, Rohit
354.article_body: A 26-year-old man has been arrested by Pune Police for invading the pitch during MI-RCB match on Saturday. He was booked by police on charges of trespassing and creating ruckus as he was seen giving fist bumps to Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma before being escorted out. A police official said that the fan also manhandled the policemen on duty.

355.title: Traffic to be suspended for 30 mins for test blast at Noida twin towers today
355.article_body: Traffic movement will be suspended for 30 minutes, from 2.15-2.45 pm on Sunday, around Supertech's twin towers in Noida, where a test blast would be carried out around 2.30 pm. The area will be cordoned off by police. "Traffic movement will be restricted from ATS junction to Gejha Phool Mandi and from Eldeco Chowk to Sector 108," an inspector said.

356.title: Reports claim Imran Khan tried to remove Pakistan Army chief, he denies
356.article_body: Ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan tried to dismiss Army chief General Qamar Javed Bajwa but a notification was not issued by the Defence Ministry, reports said. However, according to Geo News, Khan told journalists, "There was neither any talk of dismissing the Army chief nor was this on the cards." Khan lost the no-confidence vote and was removed as Pakistan's PM.

357.title: The Kashmir Files is the real game changer, not RRR: Ram Gopal Varma
357.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma believes the success of 'The Kashmir Files' is "the real game changer" being made on a small budget of ₹10 crore. "RRR isn't a game-changer and...I don't think it can bring about a change. It's a film that's produced on a lavish scale." "Whereas, if you consider 'The Kashmir Files'...It gives filmmakers... much-needed confidence," he said.

358.title: 2 minor boys drown in lake while swimming with friends in Thane
358.article_body: Two boys, aged 11 and 12 years, drowned while swimming in a lake in Thane, police said on Sunday. The incident took place when six boys from Dhamankar Naka entered the Varaladevi lake for a swim. While four of the boys came out of the lake after swimming, they informed police as they were unable to locate the two others.

359.title: Pune locals protest as BJP corporator renames garden after father
359.article_body: Residents of Pune's Salisbury Park have been protesting for the past three weeks after BJP corporator Shrinath Bhimale renamed a PMC garden after his father, late Yashwantrao Bhimale, and put up a board with the name on it. A resident forum's chairman said that while they acknowledged Bhimale's efforts for the garden, its renaming seemed like "an attempt to hog..limelight".

360.title: Alia respects everyone a lot, she's not jealous of anyone: Neetu
360.article_body: Neetu Kapoor said in an interview that actress Alia Bhatt is a very sweet and nice girl. She added that the 29-year-old actress respects everyone a lot and is not jealous of anyone. "Ranbir too is a kind-hearted guy. They both make a great pair," Neetu further said. The couple will reportedly get married in an intimate ceremony this week.

361.title: Anupam shares pic with Big B, Neena; fan says 'History of cinema in 1 pic'
361.article_body: Anupam Kher, taking to Instagram, shared a selfie with the cast of his upcoming film, 'Uunchai'. The picture featured Amitabh Bachchan, Boman Irani, Neena Gupta and Sarika. "May your day feel as good as taking a perfect selfie of perfect happy moments," Anupam wrote. Reacting to his post, a fan wrote, "History of cinema in this one picture is remarkable."

362.title: Cong should worry about itself: Mayawati on Rahul's UP alliance offer comment
362.article_body: A day after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said BSP chief Mayawati didn't respond to the party's alliance offer in Uttar Pradesh during elections, Mayawati said the Congress needs to worry about itself first. "The Congress must think 100 times before making such comments. They've been unable to win against the BJP, but they just keep taking these potshots," she added.

363.title: Ukraine says 12 soldiers returning after prisoner swap with Russia
363.article_body: Ukraine's Deputy Prime Minister Iryna Vereshchuk said that 12 of the country's soldiers are coming home following a prisoner exchange with Russia on Saturday. Apart from soldiers, Vereshchuk said that 14 civilians were also returning to Ukraine as part of the deal. This was the third such prisoner swap since the war began, she added.

364.title: Mumbai's Mithi river polluted for last 11 years: MPCB report
364.article_body: A report published by the Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB) has revealed that Mumbai's Mithi river has remained 'polluted to heavily polluted' for the past 11 years. The 17.8 km long river was found once (2012-13) in the non-polluted category in the past 11 years. The water quality index (WQI) of the river was 44 in 2020-21, the report said.

365.title: Amrinder Singh Brar appointed as Congress’ Punjab chief
365.article_body: Three-time MLA Amrinder Singh Brar, also known as Raja Warring, was appointed as the Congress' new Punjab chief by party President Sonia Gandhi on Saturday. Warring served as the Transport Minister in the previous state government. Meanwhile, Pratap Singh Bajwa was appointed as the leader of legislature party, while Raj Kumar as its deputy leader.

366.title: Comedian Munawar Faruqui confirms on 'Lock Upp' he is married and has a son
366.article_body: Comedian Munawar Faruqui, during an episode of 'Lock Upp', confirmed he is married and has a son. "I'm not hiding anything, but we've been separate for the past one-and-a-half years. The matter is in court and I don't want to discuss that. It has been difficult," Munawar said. He later suggested that he is doing the show for his son.

367.title: BJP MP shares video of 92-yr-old man completing 5 km-run in B'luru
367.article_body: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya on Sunday shared a video of a 92-year-old man completing a 5 km run at Bengaluru Marathon, saying, "[Sri Dattatreya Ji] truly symbolises the spirit of grit and determination of every Bengalurean." In the video, Surya can be seen holding Dattatreya's hand while they crossed the finish line. Surya added that Dattatreya had "outpaced" many others.

368.title: Karan shares pic of Farah shopping for 'designer wear' on New York Streets
368.article_body: Karan Johar shared a picture of choreographer-director Farah Khan as she shopped on the streets of New York. Taking to Instagram Stories, Karan posted a photo of Farah standing near a roadside shop selling sunglasses. Alongside it, he wrote, "Caught you! Shopping for high-end designer wear! Show off @farahkhankunder." Sharing Karan's post, Farah wrote, "I live for your comments @karanjohar."

369.title: Dozens of Ukrainian civilians found in grave near Kyiv
369.article_body: A grave with dozens of Ukrainian civilians has been found in Buzova village near Kyiv, the latest reported mass grave to be discovered as Russian forces retreat, an official said. Ukraine said Russia is gathering its forces in the east for a major assault and urged people to flee. UK PM Boris Johnson met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday.

370.title: RCB's Harshal Patel leaves IPL bio-bubble after death of a family member
370.article_body: RCB all-rounder Harshal Patel has left the IPL bio-bubble following the death of a family member. Harshal exited the bubble after getting to know about the tragedy in the family after the match against MI on Saturday night, PTI reported. Harshal is expected to join the bubble before RCB's next match.

371.title: YouTube blocks Russian parliament's Duma TV; Russia criticises
371.article_body: YouTube has blocked Russia's lower parliament house's broadcast channel Duma TV, saying that it was "terminated" for violating the terms of service. "YouTube has signed its own warrant," Russia's Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova said. Russian leader Vyacheslav Volodin also reacted to it, saying that this shows that the US is trying to achieve a "monopoly of information".

372.title: Fire breaks out at Ghazipur landfill site in Delhi for 2nd time in 2 weeks
372.article_body: Another fire broke out at the Ghazipur landfill site in Delhi on Saturday late night, nearly two weeks after a massive fire broke out at same site which took firefighters nearly 48 hours to extinguish. The Saturday's fire was put out within three hours after Delhi Fire Service (DFS) officials sent four fire tenders to the spot within 10-15 minutes.

373.title: We're planning such that foreigners will seek jobs in Punjab: Mann
373.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Saturday called for the stop of the "brain drain" from the state, saying, "We're planning in such...way that foreigners will come here for jobs." Following this, Congress MLA Sukhpal Khaira criticised the remark, saying, "Hope foreigners approach...but...we've to set our house in order." Mann claimed that ₹15 lakh was lost per person going abroad.

374.title: Hope I can move on: Amber shares statement ahead of Johnny Depp Defamation Case
374.article_body: Amber Heard said she hopes she and her ex-husband Johnny Depp can move on from their defamation trials, which are set to begin on April 11. On Saturday, she wrote, "I've always maintained a love for Johnny and it brings me great pain to have to live out the details of our past life together in front of the world."

375.title: IIT-Kanpur's annual cultural fest Antaragni is being held from Apr 8-10
375.article_body: Celebrating its 56th edition with the theme of 'A Nouvelle Rhapsody', IIT-Kanpur's annual cultural festival 'Antaragni' is being conducted in a hybrid mode for the first time ever. It offers a virtually immersive experience of the IIT-Kanpur Campus with all events, online and offline, being streamed on the platform. Key highlights include performances from artists Ritviz and Sunidhi Chauhan.

376.title: 'RRR' crosses ₹1,000-crore mark globally in 16 days
376.article_body: SS Rajamouli-directorial 'RRR' has crossed the ₹1,000-crore mark globally in 16 days of its release. The Ram Charan and Jr NTR-starrer 'RRR' is the third Indian film after 'Dangal' and 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion' to earn ₹1,000 crore worldwide. 'Dangal' is the highest-grossing Indian film of all time with over ₹2,000-crore worldwide earnings.

377.title: Jaffer shares scene from Yuvraj's movie as child actor; jokes about MI, CSK's losses
377.article_body: Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to share a scene from Yuvraj Singh's Punjabi movie 'Mehndi Shagna Di' to joke about MI and CSK losing their first four matches each in IPL 2022. In the scene, Yuvraj, standing with his friend, tells their teacher, "We've taken an oath that if we win, we'll win together, if we lose, we'll lose together."

378.title: David Beckham's son Brooklyn marries actress Nicola Peltz, pics from wedding surface
378.article_body: Former England football team captain David Beckham's eldest son Brooklyn tied the knot with American actress Nicola Peltz in Palm Beach. Tennis player Serena Williams, Spice Girl Mel C, fashion designer Rachel Zoe and TV chef Gordon Ramsay were among those who attended the wedding ceremony. The couple had got engaged in July 2020.

379.title: Amit Shah inaugurates Indo-Pak border viewing project at Gujarat's Nadabet
379.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday inaugurated the border viewing point on the India-Pakistan international border in Nadabet in Gujarat's Banaskantha district. The viewing point has been made on the lines of the one at Punjab's Wagah Border. According to officials, the project was developed as a tourist attraction destination at a cost of ₹125 crore by Gujarat's tourism department.

380.title: Hope you're blessed with everything: Samantha on Naga's brother Akhil's b'day
380.article_body: Samantha Ruth Prabhu, who parted ways with her ex-husband Naga Chaitanya in 2021, has penned a note on the occasion of Naga's actor-brother Akhil Akkineni's birthday. The actress, taking to her Instagram Stories, wrote, "Happy birthday Akhil. Wishing you the very best this year. I hope and pray you are blessed with everything you are looking for. God Bless."

381.title: We can also take action against Kejriwal in BJP-ruled states: Singh
381.article_body: After Punjab Police booked BJP leader Naveen Jindal, the party's West Delhi MP Parvesh Sahib Singh has said that BJP can also file FIRs against AAP leaders but the party doesn't believe in "low-level politics". "We've BJP governments in more than half of the states...we can take action against [Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal] there," he added.

382.title: 300-yr-old Karaga festival begins at Bengaluru's Dharmaraya temple
382.article_body: The 300-year-old Karaga festival began at the Dharmaraya Swamy Temple in Bengaluru on Saturday. The festival was held exclusively within the temple in the last two years owing to the Covid-19 pandemic. However this year, the organisers will take out the 'Hasi Karaga' (procession) on April 14 while the 'Karaga Shakyotsava' (the main event) will be held on April 16.

383.title: China records 1,351 new COVID-19 cases, highest in Shanghai
383.article_body: China recorded 1,351 new COVID-19 cases on Saturday, including 1,318 locally transmitted and 33 imported infections, said the country's health authorities. Shanghai, which has been put under a strict lockdown, saw 1,006 locally confirmed cases, the highest of all cities. 242 cases were reported in Jilin, 16 in Zhejiang, 10 in Guangdong, and three in Beijing.

384.title: Nana Patekar to make comeback with social-thriller 'The Confession'
384.article_body: Actor Nana Patekar is set to make an acting comeback with a social-thriller, titled 'The Confession'. It will be directed by Ananth Narayan Mahadevan, who has helmed films like 'The Xpose', 'Aksar' and 'Dil Maange More!!!'. The 71-year-old actor had reportedly taken a break from acting after actress Tanushree Dutta accused him of sexual harassment during the #MeToo movement.

385.title: Australian PM Scott Morrison calls for elections on May 21
385.article_body: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison has called for federal elections to be held on May 21. Morrison said that Governor-General David Hurley, who he met on Sunday at his residence, accepted his advice on setting the election date. Following the announcement, the opposition - Australian Labor party - tweeted, "It's time for better Medicare. It's time for better aged care."

386.title: Iceland Cricket mock third umpire over Virat Kohli's controversial dismissal
386.article_body: Iceland Cricket mocked the third umpire over ex-RCB captain Virat Kohli's controversial dismissal against MI. Iceland Cricket tweeted, "It's not easy for on-field umpires to detect inside edges or whether ball hit bat or pad first. But every TV umpire should be able to make the right call with the benefit of slow motion replays and technology like UltraEdge."

387.title: UGC India's Twitter account briefly hacked; 3rd govt account targeted in 2 days
387.article_body: The official Twitter account of University Grants Commission (UGC) India was briefly hacked on Sunday. The account's display and background pictures were changed to photos of cartoons and a long thread of tweets were posted, tagging numerous Twitter users. This comes after the Twitter accounts of Uttar Pradesh CM's Office and India Meteorological Department's (IMD) were hacked on Saturday.

388.title: Big B sends handwritten letter to Nimrat praising her performance in 'Dasvi'
388.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan recently sent a handwritten letter to Nimrat Kaur along with some flowers to praise her 'exceptional work' in her latest film 'Dasvi'.  "Your work in 'Dasvi' is exceptional - nuances, gestures, all! My deep admiration and congratulations," he wrote in the letter. Nimrat also penned a note thanking Amitabh for sending her flowers and letter for the film.

389.title: Musk takes poll to turn Twitter HQ in San Francisco into homeless shelter
389.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has started a poll on his Twitter account asking whether the firm's San Francisco headquarters should be converted into a homeless shelter. The poll read, "Convert Twitter SF HQ to homeless shelter since no one shows up anyway." The poll has got over 6.6 lakh votes till now, with over 91% answering yes.

390.title: Aus PM cooks PM Modi's 'favourite khichdi' to celebrate India trade deal, shares pics
390.article_body: Australia PM Scott Morrison took to Instagram to reveal that he celebrated his country's new trade agreement with India by cooking Indian dishes. "The curries I chose to cook for curry night...are all from my dear friend Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Gujarat province, including his favourite khichdi," he wrote. "Good job, looks delicious," an Instagram user commented.

391.title: Won't spare anyone: Telangana Minister to pubs after Hyd drug bust case
391.article_body: After the recent drug bust by the police inside a Hyderabad pub, the state's Tourism and Excise Minister V Srinivas Goud has said that they "won't spare anyone". "If need be, we will shut down everything...It's not about revenues, but the...reputation of Telangana," Goud said during a review meeting with the representatives of various pubs and bars of Hyderabad.

392.title: Johnny Lever, Rajpal Yadav arrive together at an event, fan says 'Comedy Kings'
392.article_body: Actors Johnny Lever and Rajpal Yadav, who have appeared together in films like 'Coolie No.1' and 'Hungama 2' met on Thursday at an event. A paparazzo account shared a video featuring Johnny and Rajpal from the event. The video received a lot of appreciation. One of the fans called them, "The Bollywood legends of laughter." Another user commented, "Comedy Kings."

393.title: CBI books 10 persons over TMC leader's murder that preceded Birbhum violence
393.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has registered an FIR against 10 persons in connection with TMC panchayat leader Bhadu Sheikh's murder, which allegedly led to the killing of nine persons in West Bengal's Birbhum, a senior official said. The CBI visited Rampurhat police station and collected the case diary and documents linked to Sheikh's murder investigation, the official added.

394.title: Class 10 girl killed by a speeding truck on way to exam in Surat
394.article_body: A Class 10 girl, who was going to the exam centre to write her Hindi board exam, was killed by a speeding truck near Bhesan village road in Surat. The deceased, Pragati Sadashiv (16), was going on a moped with her uncle to Segva village when the truck hit them, police said. Her uncle, Chhagan Rathod, has suffered serious injuries.

395.title: India reports 1,054 new COVID-19 cases, 29 deaths in last 24 hours
395.article_body: India has reported 1,054 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1,258 recoveries and 29 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country reported 1,150 COVID-19 cases and 83 deaths. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the country stands at 11,132, while the death toll reached 5,21,685.

396.title: Gurugram records 44.5°C, second hottest April day in 43 years
396.article_body: Gurugram witnessed its second hottest day recorded in the month of April in 43 years as the maximum temperature hit 44.5°C on Saturday. According to India Meteorological Department, the last time the city saw a higher temperature was in 1979 when it recorded 44.8°C on April 28. The maximum temperature was 10°C above the average normal, added IMD.

397.title: Right-wing workers vandalise Muslim traders' carts at K'taka temple
397.article_body: Members of the right-wing group, Sri Ram Sene, on Saturday allegedly vandalised the carts of Muslim traders outside a Hanuman temple in Karnataka's Dharwad. A video of the incident was shared online, which shows smashed watermelons on the road. "I've been doing business in front of this temple for...15 years and never had a problem," a watermelon seller said.

398.title: Women police station in Noida gets new daycare centre
398.article_body: A daycare centre for children has been started at the women police station in Noida's Sector 39. This is the second such facility in Gautam Buddha Nagar after the one in Surajpur was opened last year. DCP Vrinda Shukla said that the facility was conceptualised in January and subsequently set up with the help of a private firm.

399.title: Spain's Barcelona to ban smoking on all of its 10 beaches
399.article_body: Authorities in Spain's second-largest city Barcelona have announced that they'll ban smoking on all of the city's 10 beaches from this year. This comes after a pilot project in which smoking was banned at four beaches. "Beaches with no smoking allowed will offer healthier communal living areas, with less waste and will respect the defence of the environment," authorities said.

400.title: Harbhajan Singh asks Ashish Nehra what Rahul Tewatia eats, GT respond with a pic
400.article_body:
After GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia slammed two sixes on the last two deliveries to help his team defeat PBKS, Harbhajan Singh asked GT head coach Ashish Nehra what Tewatia eats. GT responded to Harbhajan with a screengrab from one of their videos wherein Tewatia can be seen eating fafda. "
Psst! It's a secret. Don't tell anyone," GT wrote.
